summary: Do you think it's still okay that Phoebe isn't the head writer? Like in terms of the show being the best it can be? Isn't she...
question: Do you think it's still okay that Phoebe isn't the head writer? Like in terms of the show being the best it can be? Isn't she still an executive producer, does that mean she still works on it?
answer: I think we’ll still get a good show! The question is how good. Even though I enjoyed season 2 it wasn’t as good as the perfection of season 1 and we all know it’s because Phoebe didn’t write it. But it’s okay. I hope the new showrunner sees what didn’t work well this season and takes that into account when she writes season 3. Phoebe is still an executive producer as far as I know. She doesn’t write for the show but she’s involved somehow, so that’s a good thing!

summary: Phoebe please come back we need u! I wonder if this season would look different if Pheobe was still the showrunner
question: Phoebe please come back we need u! I wonder if this season would look different if Pheobe was still the showrunner
answer: This is sad cause we’ll never know how season 2 would have looked like if Phoebe had written it. The dialogues would be different for sure. We missed Phoebe’s unique humor and tone. I think some crucial moments would have stayed almost the same like the Villaneve reunion in 2x05, them working together, Eve killing someone, Villanelle shooting Eve (?) but the plot around these events might have looked different and we would have gotten a more meaningful story around our characters. Emerald definitely talked with Phoebe about where the show was heading but at the same time Emerald got the freedom to do her own thing. It makes me wonder at what point did Emerald know that she wouldn’t be back for the next season, because we didn’t get any new information about the twelve and we got more questions than answers. We never got an answer about why Nadia wrote down the name of Aaron’s father on that note in the prison right before she got killed? What was the meaning of it! It just felt like Emerald knew she wouldn’t continue with season 3 when she was writing this season, so she purposefully left everything unclear so that the next writer can take over.

summary: Hola,llegue por el blog de una gran persona y terapeuta,me gustaría que me recomendaras dos  cosas, películas del tipo martires...
question: Hola,llegue por el blog de una gran persona y terapeuta,me gustaría que me recomendaras dos  cosas, películas del tipo martires pero no de la version americana,tipo interestelar y alguna o algunas series tipo breaking bad o dexter,saludos!
answer:
¡Hola, @coronet696​!

Películas tipo Interestelar hay varias; mis favoritas son Armageddon y El núcleo, que son ya todo un clásico; Sunshine, que no es tan conocida y está super bien. 

Del director de Martyrs (de las dos versiones) también está Ghostland, que me encantó y sorprendió mucho. He visto la versión americana de Martyrs, no la original, pero Ghostland está mucho mejor. Te dejo AQUÍ mi reseña de Ghostland.

Us también tiene ese tono de película independiente a pesar de ser una producción mucho mayor. También es mejor de lo que esperaba. Me hubiera gustado que la historia tras los clones se desarrollara un poco mejor pero como película de terror está muy bien. Pronto en el blog espero poder escribie también una reseña de esta película.

Para otras películas de terror en ESTE link puedes encontrar todas las películas del género de las que he hablado en el blog.

En cuanto a las series te recomiendo Mary me mata, te dejo reseña AQUÍ. No es una serie muy conocida. Tiene dos temporadas y una tercera y última que está emitiéndose ahora mismo. Trata de una enfermera que, como segundo empleo, se dedica a realizar eutanasias a gente que no puede seguir viviendo por enfermedades o dolores incurables. La serie, por supuesto, se centra también en cómo debe eludir a las autoridades.

Hannibal es claramente una alternativa perfecta a una serie como Dexter. Tiene tres temporadas y es una serie estupenda. Tiene psicología, es un thriller, tiene suspense, mucha sangre y asesinatos, y canibalismo, claro está. Escribí una reseña pero creo que Tumblr la ha hecho desaparecer…

Por último, Killing Eve (reseña AQUÍ) es una de las series del momento. La segunda temporada acaba de emitirse. Sigue a una asesina muy excéntrica y a una agente de la agencia británica que, de algún modo, ambas acaban obsesionándose la una con la otra.

¡Gracias por la pregunta! Si ya has visto las series tengo muchas más para recomendar :) En cuanto a las películas, no estoy tan al día y sobretodo son películas del espacio las que comparten más similitudes con Interestelar, aunque quizá películas como Orígen (Inception) también te puedan gustar porque comparten cierto estilo.

¡Un saludo!

summary: I finished the first season of killing Eve today instead of studying for my huge history test and I have so many thoughts....
body: I finished the first season of killing Eve today instead of studying for my huge history test and I have so many thoughts. Killing Eve is really good like seriously good and if you haven’t seen it I strongly recommend that you do. It is a tv show about a paid assassin and a British spy who is trying to find her and take her down. They are both weird badass women and it is a really fun tv show. The ending was so unexpected yet it made so much sense. I cant wait to watch the next season!

title: Nevermind the Spaghetti
body:
AO3 Link

Summary: In the season 2 alternate timeline where they run off together, Eve and Villanelle enjoy their first night in the hotel room. [Explicit]

They never made it to spaghetti.

They made it into the hotel room and that was it. Villanelle’s hands found Eve’s waist and pressed her back against the door as their lips met. It was fierce and passionate, filled with the all the incredible tension that had building over the past several months.

Eve took Villanelle’s face in her hands and pulled her closer. Villanelle’s fingers dug into Eve’s waist and their hips pressed together.

They broke apart for a moment and through ragged breaths, Eve whispered, “Take off your clothes. I want to see you.”

Villanelle smiled and took a step back, first removing her belt, undoing it every so slowly. Her eyes never left Eve. She held it out to the side, swinging it from side to side for a moment before dropping it to the ground. Eve was watching her every move, breaths short and fast.

Next her zipper; Villanelle took her time sliding it down, taking note of how Eve’s eyes danced over the fabric covering her breasts while she waited. Villanelle shrugged the top off and Eve bit her lip, hard. Villanelle wondered if she’d split the old cut open; she hoped so.

She slipped off her shoes, kicking them across the room and took a step back towards Eve. They made it into the hotel room and that was it. Villanelle’s hands found Eve’s waist and pressed her back against the door as their lips met. It was fierce and passionate, filled with the all the incredible tension that had building over the past several months.
